answers.answer: Hi,How are you?These symptoms can be due to diabetes. Diabetes is known to cause burning pain in the toes and fingers.Please get your blood sugar levels checked.Another cause of pain and burning can be nerve compression. This could be at the level of lower back and neck region or could be at the level of knee or ankle and wrist.Please consult your family doctor about it and undergo a complete clinical exam. Take care!

question: Hello, I have one question.  I've been searching on line, but no results.  My left foot, the ball of the foot and toes to be exact, feels very weird.  It feels very cold, almost freezing yet burnie at the same time.  Also, it hurts.  It doesn't feel like that all the tiime.  The only time it happens when I wear running shoes or when I am sitting still, let's say in the evening, without shoes on.  When I'm walking around barefoot or in flip-flops, everything is fine.  The minute I put my shoes on, it feels weird again.  Sometimes I have similar pain in right hand, digits 4 and 5What can it be?  Is there anything I can do?  Thank you very much.
title: weird feet sensations
